verses.verse: The Voice of God in a Great Storm A Psalm of David. (1 Chr 16.28, 29; Ps 96.7-9) Ascribe to the LORD, O heavenly beings, (Heb sons of gods) ascribe to the LORD glory and strength.
(2 Chr 20.21) Ascribe to the LORD the glory of his name; worship the LORD in holy splendor.
(Job 37.4, 5) The voice of the LORD is over the waters; the God of glory thunders, the LORD, over mighty waters.
(Ps 68.33) The voice of the LORD is powerful; the voice of the LORD is full of majesty.
(Isa 2.13) The voice of the LORD breaks the cedars; the LORD breaks the cedars of Lebanon.
(Deut 3.9; Ps 114.4) He makes Lebanon skip like a calf and Sirion like a young wild ox.
The voice of the LORD flashes forth flames of fire.
(Num 13.26) The voice of the LORD shakes the wilderness; the LORD shakes the wilderness of Kadesh.
(Ps 26.8) The voice of the LORD causes the oaks to whirl (Or causes the deer to calve) and strips the forest bare, and in his temple all say, “Glory!”
(Ps 10.16) The LORD sits enthroned over the flood; the LORD sits enthroned as king forever.
(Ps 28.8; 37.11) May the LORD give strength to his people! May the LORD bless his people with peace!
